caption: Not sure what's better, the savory short ribs and delicous quac or the welcoming and attentive staff and owner.  My new favorite spot in Brooklyn for Mezcals and modern mexican food!
Great tequila selection and spot on cocktails. We ordered mostly vegetarian and everything was delicious, especially the vegetables “familia”. Awesome playlist and the sweetest staff
Those short bids though... and the rosemary flan, we ordered twice!

Had the tasting menu and everything was absolutely delicious. The service and drinks were also excellent. Can't wait to come back to this place. Excellent for a nice date. Or just a fun night out with friends if you feel like treating yourselves.
Food was really flavorful and fresh.  Great variety. The drinks are really good. They make their own flavored ice cubes...
Foodgasm! I really enjoyed dining here.  The food is delish and it would definitely excites your tastebuds.
Phenomenal food. Friendly service. We tried the $60pp menu which included 7 tapas, 1 entrée, and 2 desserts of the chefs choosing. Indoor seating started tonight as well.
Came here last Wednesday to celebrate my friend’s birthday, the food was amazing and the cocktails were 5 stars , also our lovely waitress. Def coming back.

Great place for modern mexican food. Everything was good by I highly recommend the spicy salmon masa cakes and the mole pork belly! And they have a big selection of mezcal with some interesting cocktails.

Celebrated a birthday dinner at Xixa and had a wonderful time! The cocktail menu is great (really recommend to try their de-constructed drinks) and the food super tasty. Love that all the plates are meant to be shared. Service was quick and friendly. We will come back!
Terrible service, our waitress was rude and made the night all about herself. We're not here for you, get over yourself !
Worst service, the weiter was really unrespectful, Erika was amazing!
Fantastic food and great cocktails too. The chef’s tasting menu is the way to go. But come hungry— it’s a lot of food and you are going to want to eat it!
Simply amazing
Very interesting place , amazing cocktails , delicious food , very exclusive atmosphere , tables are separated with the walls so that you feel very oscillated , highly recommend this place !
We had an amazing dinner out at Xixa! Superb service! Delicious fish tacos, savory Buffalo style elite, lamb is sumptuous! We will be back. Great dinner for friends, family and couples.

Masterpiece theater  we found out about this place through word-of-mouth and committed to finding our way over there on a very brief holiday. both of us have challenges with our diet ranging from gluten-free to vegetarian.  most chefs would consider that a situation that put them with one hand tied behind their back and the other tied to the back of their head but this was one of the most memorable meals in my lifetime. our tasting menu was a surprise a minute each surprise better than the last.  if you live in the five boroughs I’m committing you to going. otherwise just put it on your bucket list and make sure you don’t die before you get to go.
The food is soooooo good my god. I love the churros, crunchy on outside but soft on inside. They have many cocktail choices. Very impressive!
Very neat and accessible spot. They serve large meals and for inexpensive prices. I liked the meals a lot and the staff were very welcoming and explanatory. Highly recommended.
(Translated by Google) The food was delicious but the waiter's attitude was poor, limping, but the Moxi brother who helped pour water was much better.  (Original) 食物好吃但是服務員態度不佳，跩跩的，反而是幫忙倒水的墨裔小哥態度好多了。

My date and I loved the chef’s choice menu. Although neither of us is a big tequila drinker, we also loved our drinks. If you’re choosing between Xixa and its sister restaurant Traif, I’d still definitely choose Traif. It’s just absolutely incredible!
One of the best Mexican Japanese fusion meals ever. Don't miss this cozy and exquisite place in Brooklyn

Love this place. Had so many special occasions here. Heather and her husband, the Chef, make a dream team. The food hits the spot and the decor is so stylish. We love them & the delectable food botv @ Xixa & Traif! Thanks Heather! You’re the best!

had one of the best meals of my life for my birthday.. it was pre fix though we chose not to do the cocktail pairing so we could choose our own drinks. we requested everything as vegetarian and every single dish was incredible but i will absolutely never forget the birthday cake tres leches. the entire experience was impeccable as a whole and service exceptionally kind. thank you xixa!
well organised Restaurant... Very rich food
The tasting menu is an absolute steal!!! Honestly I have no idea why the restaurant was almost empty when we were there, it's well priced, food was amazing, waiters super nice, great atmosphere.
Delicious! Price is well worth it for the quality of food! Really great cocktail menu with an amazing spread of food! We would recommend the duck!
Amazing

Came here on A Saturday night for the Tasting Menu dinner. $55/pp for 9 small plates. Our waiter was wonderful, Informative and helpful but not too pushy or intrusive . We started off with the Spicy Hibiscus Margarita ($14) and the Winter Tiki cocktail ($14). The spicy Hibiscus margarita was not my cup of tea: tasted a little like cough syrup,to be honest. The Winter Tiki though, was delicious. Served in a cute clear pineapple tiki glass, it was a perfectly refreshing cocktail of coconut tequila, pineapple and lime juice. For the tasting menu, we got the following items:. Guacamole,  snapper tempura fish tacos, spicy tuna tartare sopes, foie gras al pastor, hamachi sashimi, lamb chorizo meatballs,  heritage pork osso bucco, tres leches cake with coconut ice cream and churros with passionfruit and chocolate dipping sauces. We were absolutely stuffed afterwards. Highly recommend doing the tasting menu here!

Xixa has a unique twist on Mexican food. My roommate first brought me here and we had the tasting menu. We also ordered frescas which were delicious. I would highly recommend you come hungry to enjoy the tasting menu. It's delicious and highlights fantastic flavors!

Plates to share some coming with a group is a great experience. Every plate we had was delicious. Drink menu is all tequila and mezcal but the plays on the traditional cocktails are great. Would highly recommend
Inventive and original modern Mexican food with attentive and efficient service. Enjoyed it!
Absolutely positively unreal
Amazing food and service!
The best in all ways
Loved the coziness of the Is restaurant. Food was amazing and service was A+

Came for drinks & snacks and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. We arrived with no reservation on a Sat evening and didn't have to wait too long to be seated at the bar, which has ample space for having a several plates served at the same time.  Lovely ambience, slightly upscale without being overly ambitious. There is a wonderful energy throughout the restaurant, it's great for both small and large groups.  Innovative food and drinks. Love that they present it in a very humble manner. We had the deconstructed margarita, as well as a mezcal beverage, both were used cubes to start off the beverage alcohol-forward, which slowly melted to taste more flavorful.  We loved the foie gras el pastor, and the charred carrots.  I would definitely come back again.
New fave Mexican tapas!! Amazing and deliciously complex variety of food and drinks with a Latin bent.
Interesting food

amazing food, nice cocktails, and good prices. Attentive service. Guac is a must have. BBQ corn is very flavorful. Confit short rib was insanely good and is a generous share size. espresso flan was excellent.

Amazing had the tasting menu which was $55.00 and the mezcal tastings for an additional $35.00 had a total of 11 small dishes which included two deserts. Not all meals are equal I went with my wife. Next to us there were 2 couples which got the same tasting menu there food was a bit better than ours and they got the bone morrow which we did not which bumbed me out a touch hense the four stars. But all and all I will be back

This place is no joke my new favorite restaurant in New York. It's an amazing experience from start to finish. Starting with the creativity and brilliance of the menu. We started with some deconstructed drinks. This included frozen cocktail cubes that melted into your spirit of choice and CHANGED THE DRINK's pallet as dinner progressed. I had the Tea At Sunset in a giant 20 oz goblet and I tried the blueberry Pomegranate option. Both aren't even drinks. They are more like drinkable Art. Then came the buffalo elote. Not sure if that's a popular dish but it's brilliant. So close to eating a chicken wing due to corn core. The tostada was fresh and flavorful as well. The Goat Neck Barbacoa was a real treat. I'm talkin fall off the bone, shred with a spoon, PERFECTLY cooked and seasoned. The fresh tortilla and carefully selected toppings will have you reeling. We couldn't resist desert at that point so we chose the Blueberry Tres Leches and churros. And they did not disappoint. Tres Leches was delicious and airy and the churros may have been the best I've ever had. Crisp on the outside creamy on the inside with a delicious citrusy confit for dipping. Mark my words, I'll be back for a second and third visit. Wow!

Food is good. Drinks are great. Only thing - not healthy. Ordered: burrata - was so so honestly, more like desert; chicken wings- we loved it but very spicy; foie Gras- also too sweet and small portion; guacamole -was good; tres leches cake - delicious.
Delicious tapas dishes!

(Translated by Google) Best service, exquisite cocktails fantastic food. An all-round successful evening!  Thanks a lot for this outstanding dinner!  (Original) Bester Service, vorzügliche Cocktails fantastisches Essen. Ein rundum gelungener Abend!  Thanks a lot for this outstanding Dinner!
Very excellent experience !
Best Mexican food! The old fashion mezcal is Amazing.
The little bee cocktail was fantastic, and the pork belly mole is to die for
(Translated by Google) EXCELLENT PLACE  (Original) EXCELENTE LUGAR

Xixa is the kind of place you just want to try everything on the menu. Went there a first time with 3 friends and obviously could not do it, but had a blast. This time I came back with 5 friends and we almost ordered all they had to offer. Boy this was so good... But maybe a bit too much of food :) I recommend the goat neck, the short ribs, the carrots, the  ceviche and the tuna tartare with watermelon....Oh and did I tell you about their cocktails. To die for. A bit expensive overall but it's definitely worth it. 5 stars.
epic tacos and amazing drinks. I'll be back

The food here is definitely tastefully thought out. It’s nit just tapas, they also have larger sharing items on the menus like the goat neck taco which was fire, the carrot elote are also a must try. We ended are dinner with the matcha green tea flan which was the best desert I’ve had in a while, Matcha lovers go get it while you can. The service from the server felt a little rushed to order, although Beto the “help” was amazing to us even though he wasn’t our server, he sealed the night for us, thanks Beto!
I really love the deconstructive tequila drinks and the food is quite nice.
Amazing amazing.

When you have over 20 people in a group and when the end of the meal finally comes, everyone leaves satisfied, thats when you know you chose the right place! Wow, is the 1st thing out of my mouth. Everyone's mouth said wow and yum. We officially did not know what was coming out of the kitchen since we went with the tasting menu. Maybe theu should rename it to the menu full of taste?  We had Alex and Casey as our servers, Alex was doing the brunt of the service and Casey was his silent partner. They were also taking care of other tables as well. They must have put 100,000 steps during the time we spent.  You imagine as you are carrying 6 drinks on a tray and while you are serving them, others un your group are tugging on your clothes because they need drinks or because their delicious drinks are done, they are looking for more. Both Alex and Casey performed like pros in this manner.  We started with with some chios, unlike any chip yoh are used to, with an avocado type dip. The chio felt like a cross between potato and vegetable and the avocado had a seasoning better than regular guac. Next came the bone marrow and the homemade soft fluffy tortillas with additional flavors to add on the side. When the butter shrimp came out, they had me by the horns. The shrimp comes with these flavorful button mushrooms that melts in your mouth.  The flavors that come out from the butter shrimp is amazing. When you think you are impressed, something new comes out and impresses you even more. That was the fish tacos simply put. They are named Snapper tempura fish tacos with kimchee cabbage and habanero jam. I really recommend to look at the menu because there are so many fantastic choices. Then the roasted leek quesadilla came out. By this time your stomach is starting to stay STOP, but your olfactory system says MORE. The octopus with chirizo came after that and omg were so delicious. Unlike octopus anywhere else. The whole time you are eating, they are also serving their signature drinks which are numerous for this place. You can choose sangria, some delish beers and wines, but i recommend the deconstructed drinks consisting of an "old fashioned" flavored cube made of bitters, spices and citrus and add one of the huge selection of unheard of smooth mezcals and tequilas they offer.  They also have softer versions of other drinks as well. You will have a lot of choices. Finally, vanilla flan and the fresh made churros with chocolate and passionfruit dips to finish it off and send you home happy.
Everything is delicious. Can't go wrong here.

An interesting Mexican fusion spot. The tasting menu is the best way to eat here, giving you a taste of everything they have on offer (and they’ll tweak it if you are a picky eater)  Quite pricey but a great experience, especially when paired with the cocktail selection.
Excellent
Show
Awesome food and service!!
Excellent food and great service.

I'm always wary of fusion or reconstructed cuisine. This place though, it delivers on the promise. The reimagining of Mexican dishes feels like an ode, and the execution is superb. The goat neck bar aco a with beet tortillas was amazing, but there wasn't a single miss across all 7 dishes.

I give it a 5🌟 because the quality food was tasty😁 something different than the classic traditional mexican food. The dessert was just a special touch in my tummy😋 and the drinks 🍹 were just awsome. I definitely recommend this awsome place to anyone. I choosed the chefs menu and i dont regret it. 😉😀.. Happy with this restaurant experience. 😄

Came in on a slow night so got the perfect amount of attention from the staff. Bartender was very helpful and knowledgeable of the many cocktail adventures you can take. We tried small plates that were delicious and clever takes on Mexican dishes. The fundido might be one of the best I’ve had. Will come back to do the chef selections at some point.
Amazing experience. Food is welcoming and delisious . Presentation is a plus and Cal is one amazing waiter.

I will have to go back and try it again but the service was bad/slow, our table was dirty the entire night, water barely refilled and all of the dishes were way too salty. It was a disappointment because of how much I enjoyed Traif their sister restaurant.
The food is great, but every interaction I had with the staff was incredibly pretentious and rude. Too many great places in this city to waste time here.
Ordered a chef's choice meal (for two people) and it was a bit too much food. Couldn't finish last two dishes so we took them to go instead. Overall the food was good.
Genius! Especially rewarding as a couple soliciting the chef’s choice for both food and cocktails. Wow!
Order the bone marrow.
Yummy! Really nice, friendly staff!
First the food is the BEST, like I dream about it. They made me realize chicken wings are amazing!!! Also Heather the owner is the sweetest! You couldn’t ask for anything better!

I think I may have found a new favorite restaurant.  The deconstructed cocktails are an innovative approach to the old-fashioned or the margarita. Here's what that is: three large blocks (1 cubic inch) of ice. Water ice, salty ice, and (in my case) a deep purple concord grape ice spiked with habanero. Pour a generous shot of the tequila or mezcal of choice over the ice blocks and sip slowly while the ice melts.  I guess I'll have to come back to try everything on the menu. We went for the garlic shrimp (spectacularly laden with mushrooms), the grilled octopus (very nice kick to that one), and the Peking duck carnitas (served with tortillas, three kinds of dipping sauce, chopped garlic, and a nice corn salsa).
Margarita cube drinks were an innovative twist. The rib and shrimp were outstanding. Would definitely recommend the chef tasting menu.
Probably my favorite food in nyc. It's always a delight to go.
We had SUCH an incredible evening at Xixa. The food was unbelievably creative, the drinks we're perfect and the people there were amazing. We will be back very soon
From carrots to ice cubes, everything has so much though and detail. It doesn't hurt that it also tastes amazing

The food is hit or miss and the service is a bit weird. The guac and fish tacos were pretty good but the tuna ceviche wasn’t. We ordered about 5 things and they spaced them out over almost three hours.  The cocktail menu is confusing and need a lot of explaining, and the wine list is divided into sections named after celebrities. Your guess is as good as mine.
The best restaurant I've eaten at in NY to date. every dish was amazing.
Modern Mexican cuisine that can be ordered as tasting menu or a la carte.
Very good food. Chef menu a good option.
Awesome funky atmosphere. Tasting menu For The Win!
Super fun vibe, great music and cocktails, over salted food but for a light dinner before going out it’s perfect

My absolute favorite restaurant in the city. The have Mexican inspired fusion cuisine and everything is delicious. My favorite foods are the Thai garlic edamame and the buffalo corn. My friends also loved the short rib and the fois gras tacos. Their service is also impeccable and I've had a large birthday party and small intimate dinners here.
Very tasty for a good price

New favorite Mexican restaurant in NYC. Incredible food all around, authentic and delicious. All the flavors were amazing. Ordered the ceviche, octopus, pork belly tacos, bone marrow tacos, brussel sprouts and edamame. All are amazing and can't  miss! House-made tortillas are all delicious, like little round pillows for your tacos. Reminded me at times of Pujol un CDMX. Highly recommended and will definitely come back.

This is my favorite restaurant in the country, and it's not close. The flavor, texture, and preparation of each dish is impeccable. Every time I've been here, I've ordered the chef selection, which is a multi-course sampling of various dishes on the menu. You give them your dietary restrictions, but the specific dishes they bring out is up to them.  Each time, they have proceeded to bring dish after dish of things I don't particularly like and would never order in any other restaurant. Ceviche, shrimp, octopus, bone marrow, goat neck, foie gras, steak tartare, flan, etc. And each time, I was blown away with how good it was.  The tasting menu runs about $55 a person. I typically dine by myself, and the portion sizes are absolutely massive. Two, maybe three people could easily be satisfied with what I was served.  The service is excellent, the atmosphere is great. It really is that good.
Best churros I've ever had
Had the tasting menu. It was really good.

Chef Jason Marcus's homage to Mexican w creative international accents. Expect tempura skate wing tacos and fois gras al pastor. Mescal & Tequila bar in front, dark sultry feminine dining room in the rear. Clever cocktail list w flavored ice cubes and housemade aqua fresca. A playfully grouped wine list. (descriptors are based on famous starlets, etc). Small plates for sharing but also large format plates for grander feasting. Wkdays usually easier, wkends expect a wait.
Good place to go too.

Food was excellent, but the service was very inconsistent and slow. We weren't in a rush, so that was ok, but it felt like the dishes on the tasting menu could have been spaced out better. Duck and foie gras was the star of the show.
Quick service, great food. Friendly staff.
We got the fixed menu. The fun was pretty exciting and fun. We got a pitcher for drinks which was a great idea. The music was VERY loud. So avoid if that bothers you.

This place is amazing. First of all, they sat me before my whole party had arrived. Who does that in New York these days? Much less on a Friday night. The food is inventive and delicious, the service friendly and on top of its game, and the agave spirits list is quite sip-worthy (not to mention the inexplicably but quite pleasantly extensive wine list). Standouts were the fish tacos, the bone marrow tacos, the scallops, and the carrots.
Delicious food!
One of the better Mexican restaurants in NYC. The tasting menu is fairly priced and comes with a LOT of food. Wonderful staff. Check it out.
Wonderful Mexican style food. Very flavourful and fresh tasting. Also an awesome selection of hard to find tequilas. Ate at the bar and service was very friendly and responsive.
Incredible food, we had 6 different dishes and they were beautifully delicious food!! Great friendly service too. Will definitely be back
Fantastic local bar/restaurant serving up amazing tacos, amazing nachos, and of course some of the finest cocktails in Brooklyn. Say hi to the owner Leif, he's an upstanding gentleman.

Enjoyed every moment of our meal here; my best meal of 2018 so far. We did the tasting menu and cocktail pairing which was worth every penny. Fantastic, unique flavors and high-quality, unpretentious service. Especially great for dining after 9pm; there’s something about food like this when the sun has gone well below the horizon.

Offers a wonderful blend of flavors and seasonal ingredients, with an emphasis on skillful kitchen techniques. They provide appearance, aroma, texture and flavors in abundance ( with the tasting menu, especially).
Great place with good food, cocktails, mezcal.  Everything was fresh and tasty
Great drinks.  Low key ambiance

Super creative excellent food. The carrots are one of the best dishes I’ve ever had in my entire life. I kid you not. They literally melt in your mouth and are so full of flavor from the feta sauce omggg so amazing I ordered two of them. Not your typical mexican restaurant. Very cool interior design. Will definitely be back.

I’m not the type to typically leave reviews, but wow! I had such a great experience here. Great cocktails and the food was beautiful. Blue crab ceviche! Bone marrow tacos! Peking duck tacos! Garlic shrimp and saffron risotto! But the show stopper might have been the roasted carrots! Like how did they make carrots that delicious?!? Keep it up Xixa. Already look forward to next time.
A fun and energetic place for Mexican and Spanish bites and drinks!

A second and third visit to this high-end, unique Mexican fusion restaurant proves that it's indeed one of a kind. Unique thoughtful dishes, including excellent vegetarian options, accompanied by creative and delicious cocktails and served by a professional and kind staff. I highly recommend the onion soup (a surprise) and the fajitas.

We came here once several years ago when they first opened and liked it, but never went back. I've always loved traif the restaurant they own down the same street.  Xixa was a really pleasant surprise. Traif was too busy so we went here and the food was excellent. It's Mexican-ish with the same taste first, creativity second execution that I've come to love at traif. I always find great flavor combinations that delight and inspiration in their food.  I'm totally stealing the idea of elotes carrots and serving them at my next dinner party. Love the buffalo style corn elotes which totally worked, too!  I'm pretty sure I'm still thinking about the garlic butter shrimp risotto.  The large-format plates were very generous. We have the giant short ribs which was a bargain at the price. We had to bring it home with us.  The people next to us had the duck as part of the tasting menu which is a bargain at $55 per person. There was a half a duck and they took the rest of it home.  The bartenders were really friendly and the cocktails were balanced and a little too easy to drink. I will definitely not wait so long to eat there again.
The food was delicious! Definitely recommend the tasting course. Very good bang for the buck! Some dishes were a little on the salty side though
They really can do no wrong. Throw a dart st the menu. It will wow you.
So underrated. So good. Food is so much for price. Tequila cocktails are great too!
The food is fantastic One of the best bargains in the city for great affordable food

A fun and energetic place for Mexican and Spanish bites and drinks! After much deliberation, we ordered the Chefs Selection menu, which offers a plethora of tasty dishes from the menu to savor. While beautifully prepared, some items were a tad overly seasoned. Nonetheless, I had an enjoyable evening, and would come back again!
It was way too small, I don't like small crowded areas.  The food was delicious though.
Everything that comes out of the kitchen was great.
Honestly one of the best tasting menus out there

Great place! They seem to have an interesting take on food. I liked the way the drinks menu is built, deconstructed and all that. Idea is really good, it's novel but the drinks tasted okay. Tacos were scrumptious. Lamb filling in the tacos was really good. The meat was perfectly cooked through and had all the flavors in the right amount. Guacamole was refreshing but the chips could have been better. The idea of having an assortment of chips is nice, however, not all of the chips were good. I would still prefer guac with just corn chips! Churros was a great disappointment. They were burnt,  had totally lost their shape and did not look appetizing at all. All in all, we had a good dining experience! I would love to visit this restaurant again!
The food was delicious. I like the descriptions and quotes on the wine list, very creative.
Excellent Mexican food, I highly recommend the Tasting Menu, well worth the cost and you for sure will not leave hungry.
Cool spot ask for danni

Small spot but really good food. Not your basic run of the mill Mexican resturant. A lot of Mexican classics with a twist. They have a prefix menu if you're really hungry (5 smaller dishes and 1 entree), opted to just order a few dishes as the small plates are actually filling.
Nice and friendly place. Deconstructed cocktails and delicious mexican food (with a plus).
Amazing! Service and food were top notch 👌
(Translated by Google) No words are needed. Miao  (Original) 말이 필요없습니다. 쵝오
Beautiful and tasty food! Definitely recommend the chef's selection of its your first time.
Great service, excellent food. Best place in Williamsburg hands down

My wife decided to try this place. I was very happy she did the food was spectacular. We decided on the tasting menu since there were so many options and the portions seem small but with the 8 to 10 tastings including 1 large portions (we had the duck) you were not left hungry. I would say that I would order 8 of the 9 things we had again. (The bone marrow was tastless) but that's just me. Everything else was good and the drinks with the artisan cubes made of all sorts of different ingredients to enhance the flavor of the liquor was genius.
Great food and service, really nice to our large group
Upscale Mexican with a twist
Delicious and beautiful food. A modern take on Mexican food.
Honestly one of the best places I've ever eaten in my life. I could not stop trying new dishes. Buffalo corn, carrots, pork belly, and ribs were all out of this world.
Fantastic service and a great selection of mezcal and tequila. The food was outstanding and I would highly recommend anything on the menu. The duck IMO was the star of the meal
Interesting food served by excellent people.
Expensive but probably the fanciest Mexican food I've ever had in my life.
Very good food, just like it's sister restaurant next door, and inventive drinks!
Very good special meal out.
Delicious
Phenomenal food in this sister restaurant to Traif. Call for reservations otherwise you probably won't get in

The food was solid - but the service was terrible. Lots of confusion and extended periods of time between dishes arriving at the table. Our waiter might have been having a bad night but he was extremely rude. The owner made a gracious attempt to smooth things over but we will not be returning - too many other amazing restaurants in Williamsburg
Marvelous food!!!!
You can't leave without doing the 11 dish meal. You will not be disappointed.
Excellent food and drink but DO NOT TAKE AMERICAN EXPRESS!
Amazing creative dishes plus friendly service and great cocktails. Blue crab thingys are a must!

The food here was really great! The short rib tacos are melt in your mouth.  Even the homemade corn tortilla is great. Our waiter was on point and very knowledgeable.  My friend has celiac disease and can't eat gluten. The waiter knew exactly what was good to order and even got us a bottle of wine we liked. Definitely want to go here again! Oh and the music....FUN!!

This is a review of the even by Tasting Collective that we attended. It was a 10-course brunch, created especially for this event (they don't usually serve brunch).  When we arrived at Xixa, we were wondering “is this the place?” There was no fancy, glamorous sign outside, well, not much of anything outside. Just a little “Xixa” painted on a wall, close to the ground. But with just one step inside, we were transported into this gorgeous, modern, lovely restaurant! There was no way to know or imagine that this beautiful space exist from just looking at the restaurant from the outside.  At the first glance, The restaurant doesn’t look that big. Just a long bar and a communal table. But the long restaurant kept on going. They had more tables after the bar and communal table, both booth and table seating.  The chef Jason Marcus told us how he fell in love with Mexican food during his visits to Mexico. He brings out his creation of Mexican-inspired dishes. We got to try so many of wonderful, creative, tasty creations such as Breakfast Tacos, Baked Poulet Rouge Chicken & Mojo Verde Albondigas, Chilaquiles, Corn & Buttermilk Baked Pancake, and more!  All of the items were tasty, and I liked the innovative, upscale Mexican dishes. The chef was very personable and funny, and I could tell he had passion for Mexican food and coming up with his own creations. The staffs were nice and efficient, it was really fun! I love finding a new, great restaurant while socializing, sharing plates with each other like a good ol’ friends. I would love to go back to Xixa for their regular menus.  Read my full review of this restaurant and food on my food blog, foodlovergirl.
Excellent place, food was great

Great service. Just do the chef's menu because you get a great tour of the dishes. I enjoyed the carrots, the Edamame is INSANE, the duck was a bit fatty and awkward to eat but delicious. When I went for Valentine's day I was disappointed. Lots of fried food, inconsistent temperature, and lots of uninspired dishes. I'm happy we came but definitely won't be back.

Started with the deconstructed margaritas. Then the winter guacamole this chips are so good specially the cheese chip. Bone marrow tacos are super delicious. Roasted carrots wow I never had carrot tasted that good. We got the short rib tacos and finished it off with churro with chocolate and passion fruit dipping with a side of guava jalapeño sorbet. Amazing food that will give your tast buds refreshing sensation. Each dish is unique and well delivered.

Loved the cocktails.  Hard to find something original when everyone's gone crazy for cocktails, these were in a league of their own.  Do the tasting menu, it was delicious, original, and a huge amount of food.

Food was ok but service was strange. The first thing that happened is we were introduced to a bunch of rules by the waitress. For instance, you can't order dishes at different times, you must order everything at once. Management needs to realize they can't enforce "rules" like this for a restaurant.
great tasting menu
Pretty delicious and interesting combinations (slightly pricy). Note: there is no sign outside so is easy to miss.

The food and service is fantastic. My only complaint would be that the seats at the bar are metal and cold so not very comfortable. Be sure to make a reservation in advance they get very booked up. Id recommend the guac, edamame, tartar, and 3 cheese fondue. Id love to try the bone marrow next time.
Good introduction to the foodie world for newbies and just an amazing restaurant all around. My fiancee and I have been going here since they opened.
Always delicious plates of food. If they are busy walk down the road to the sister restaurant Traif
Foie gras and carrots!  That's about all you need to know about this place!
Every course was delicious. The staff was a little hipster pretentious but doesn't matter it's all about the food. Great incentive drinks too.
Great Mexican/Spanish restaurant. Everything extremely delicious.
Chef's tasting menu is well worth the price.

I convinced my family to go to Xixa for my birthday- being Jewish my parents were excited and nervous based on the name of the restaurant alone. My brother and sister knew to expect the unexpected. And what they didn’t expect was to enjoy it all so much! The food was amazing- the drinks were delicious and fun. I convinced my mom to split a basil shot! It was basil-ly heaven! If you like Tequila –you need to go to Xixa for a drink; if you aren’t sure if you like Tequila; you need to go and discover how awesome it is. I definitely want to go back and try the chef’s creations!

not sure where to begin. the food was simply amazing. we picked the chef's tasting menu which was well worth the price. the chef/owner himself brought the food over to us. we were beyond full before we hit the halfway mark of the meal. the atmosphere was energetic and hip. lots of happy faces and full stomachs. we will be back for sure, this time i'll starve myself for a couple of days.  **** MAKE RESERVATIONS! WALK IN'S ARE NOT GUARANTEED SEATING EVEN WITH TWO PEOPLE! ****

Tapas style. Every plate seems to be meant for two people to share (any more and you're getting one bite a person). The food is very interesting. Very cheesy. Surprisingly the vegetarian dishes were much better than most of the meat ones. I enjoyed the appetizers much more than the entrees. A bit pricey as well.
This is my favorite brooklyn restaurant hands down!

It's difficult to review Xixa without comparing it to its sister restaurant, Traif. Similar to its sibling, Xixa offers a difficult-to-categorize cuisine, but one that pulls inspiration from Mexican techniques and ingredients. In addition to having an intriguing drink and food menu, Xixa offers a tasting menu at $40 for parties of four or more, a dining option that should definitely be taken advantage of. The dishes rotate regularly, but from the meal we had here, the standout dishes were: - Skirt Steak: Cooked to a perfect medium rare and served with a side of red onions and corn, it was the romesco sauce that really brought out the flavor of this dish. - Brussel Sprouts: These are quite possibly the most delicious brussel sprouts I have yet to taste in NYC. They're doused in a spicy-sweet vin, lightly fried, and mixed with strawberries, currants, and sunflower seeds. They're crisp but not too crunchy, covering the spectrum of spicy to salty to sweet, and disappeared within seconds from our table. - Foie Gras Al Pastor: This was the first time I tried foie gras paired with fruit, and it was a combination that worked startlingly well. The foie gras is perfectly seared and tender, and the sweetness from the pineapple and torrejas (a Mexican version of the traditional French Toast) adds even more richness and dimension to each bite. - Churros: Served as the dessert at the end of our meal, they're warm, crisp on the outside, yet still somewhat doughy in the center. The best part was digging into the raspberry sorbet it came with and realizing that it had been made with a healthy dose of chilies in the mix as well.  Call in advance for reservations and make sure to come with at least three others to take advantage of the tasting menu.
Meh. Trying hard but ultimately failing. Too much show, not enough substance.

I ate here with a group of coworkers with a prefixed dinner, and everything was outstanding. They were happy to accommodate my dietary restrictions, and the food was absolutely delicious, as were the drinks. Flavor was incredible across the board, far from chips and salsa with a frozen marg. This definitely felt like Mexican fine dining, if that's a thing.
Tasting menu was a great night out. Literally a "confrontation amount of food" in a good way. Service was excellent.
Is ok... I was expecting more.
Loved it
Amazing service and food
Simply delicious. The desserts were perfect. And the service was great too. I'll surely yo back.
Gotta get the Foie Gras!
Great dishes... I particularly love the avacodo hummus, fried Brussel sprouts, steak tartare tacos and the al pastor!!!! Great all around

Personally I didn't think this was *quite* as good as its sister restaurant Traif, but the food is still delicious, well priced and the Mexican slant may make some people happier than the pork and fried nature of the place a few doors down.

Xixa is the sister spot to my favorite tapas restaurant in the city, Traif, and they are literally on the same block. The menu is a variety of Mexican-Asian fusion inspired tapas with tequila and wine the only options for drinks, no margaritas here folks. Some of my favorite dishes included the Fricco-Dilla: crushed potatoes, red chorizo, sunny egg, black bean and tomatillo and Mexico-City sautéed edamame covered in chile, lime and toasted garlic, simple yet delicious. The killer item though was the carne asada Korean short ribs with bulgur poblano tomato salad that rounded out the meal nicely (expect to order between 4-6 plates to be full). Finish off with the salty churros, passion fruit and jalapeño sorbet and you won't regret coming here.  Bottom Line: While it can't steal the crown from  its siblingTraif, this is a fantastic addition to the best tapas joint in town.

The ambiance here is amazing, the food is excellent and Xixa pays special attention to how it is plated.  I appreciate that.  I love this place, the creativity and the preparation.  Great place for a date.

We went all out and got the $40pp tasting menu here. It was too much food. I'd suggest doing to a la carte. Whatever you do order the duck wraps with banana. AMAZING! They were very good about not rushing us even though it was a Saturday night. They will bring out a candle if its someone's birthday which is a nice touch.

We had an amazing meal at XiXa last evening.  The food was extraordinary and the service was charming.  We were a party of 4 and had the tasting menu, which let us concentrate on the excellent food and ignore trying to figure out the menu descriptions. Dinner was made up of about a dozen small dishes for the group and each one was perfect.  The highlights were carne asada with a reduction of red wine and foie  gras, and a scallop ceviche on a fresh tostada. For my Manhattan friends, it was very easy to get there and to get home.  It is just a quick walk from the Marcy Ave stop on the M train, and being right at the entrance ramp to the Williamsburg Bridge, getting a cab home was a cinch. I can't wait to go again!
